profileText: (Father of Jonas Platt), a Delegate from New York; born in Huntington, Long Island, Suffolk County, N.Y., May 27, 1735; received an English education; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Poughkeepsie, N.Y.; Member of the Provincial Congress 1775-1777; member of the council of safety in 1777; served in the state senate 1777-1783; Member of the Continental Congress in 1785 and 1786; member of the council of appointment in 1778 and 1781; county judge of Dutchess County 1781-1795; founded the town of Plattsburg in 1784; delegate to the state constitutional convention in 1788; moved to Plattsburg, N.Y., in 1798 and continued the practice of law; regent of the state university from 1791 until his death; one of the projectors of the Erie Canal; died in Plattsburg, N.Y., September 12, 1807; interment in Riverside Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: 1745-1846, 0.25 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: The Zephaniah Platt papers contain family correspondence, consisting primarily of letters to Zephaniah Platt by his children. Topics of the correspondence concern chiefly land matters involving Zephaniah Platt and others, for the most part in Dutchess and Clinton Counties, New York. Family members, military officers, government officials, and proprietors of patents are represented. There are some letters to family member Reverend Frederick Halsey who founded the First Presbyterian Church of Plattsburgh. Financial and legal items include an account memorandum book of Zephaniah Platt for 1785, business agreements, military certificate and inspection returns for Clinton County, receipts, and estate papers and wills for Gerard W. Beekman, Gisbert Pele [Pelze?], and John Platt. Land papers consist of abstracts, agreements (including a list of the original proprietors for Plattsburgh), deeds and maps for lands in Nine Partners Patent, Dutchess County and various patents in Clinton County. There are seven maps including Sadaqueda Patent, 1784, Oneida County, New York; Bell's Tracts, [Clinton County], New York; Township No. 24, [Somerset, Windham County, Vermont?]; Dean's, Beekman's, and Kelly's Patents, Clinton County, New York; and two which are unidentified. An unpublished guide is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1776-1894, 14 items.
researchRecord.description: Miscellaneous papers of Zephaniah Platt contain a memoranda on the military history of the colonies, 1776-1779; documents from his service as Justice of the Peace, 1791-1798; and a notice concerning his estate, 1830. Other family items include muster roll of John Platt's corps of infantry, 1812, and regimental orders signed by John Platt, 1814; letters from Bethiah W. Ganoe concerning Zephaniah Platt and the Platt family, 1894; and undated letters by Sarah E. Angell concerning the Platt and Adriance families.
